Issues.Title: Fails to build .NET Core WPF app using x86 "dotnet build "
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.1.101
* Windows version: 10.0.18362
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: No
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? No


 **Problem description:**

I'm not able to build a .NET Core WPF app from the command line using the x86 version of dotnet.exe. It seems like the "Program files (x86)" text gets expanded to "Program Files %28x86%29" when used as the AssemblyFile argument to UsingTask in "Microsoft.WinFX.targets".

I assume this can be caused by a bug in "dotnet build", rather than WPF.
 
 **Actual behavior:**

`"c:\Program Files (x86)\dotnet\dotnet.exe" build` prints error:

> C:\Program Files (x86)\dotnet\sdk\3.1.101\Sdks\Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WindowsDesktop\targets\Microsoft.WinFX.targets(228,9): error MSB4062: The "Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Windows.MarkupCompilePass1" task could not be loaded from the assembly C:\Program Files %28x86%29\dotnet\sdk\3.1.101\Sdks\Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WindowsDesktop\tools\netcoreapp2.1\PresentationBuildTasks.dll. Could not load file or assembly 'C:\Program Files %28x86%29\dotnet\sdk\3.1.101\Sdks\Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WindowsDesktop\tools\netcoreapp2.1\PresentationBuildTasks.dll'. The system cannot find the path specified. Confirm that the <UsingTask> declaration is correct, that the assembly and all its dependencies are available, and that the task contains a public class that implements Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITask. [C:\Sci\Tests\DotnetWpfTest\DotnetWpfTest.csproj]

 
 **Expected behavior:**

It should be possible to  build a simple WPF app using both x86 and x64 .NET Core.

 **Minimal repro:**

Run this in a command prompt with both .NET Core 3.1 SDK (x64) and .NET Core Core 3.1 (x86) installed:

    md DotnetWpfTest2
    cd DotnetWpfTest2
    dotnet new wpf

    REM dotnet build will work
    dotnet build

    REM '"c:\Program Files (x86)\dotnet\dotnet.exe" build' causes error 
    "c:\Program Files (x86)\dotnet\dotnet.exe" build
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Fails to build .NET Core WPF app using x86 "dotnet build "" (#2483)

Issues.Title: Visual Studio Crash when developing UWP project
Issues.Body:
Copied from VSO ID: 1011513

When in UWP project development, after I close the currently debuged application and try to select other tab with typed code, visual studio just stops respond and crashes. As it happens quite often, it creates VS for UWP hardly usable. Hope recorded logs will help.


Failure in WPF....

Issues.Title: MutexRights is not available in .NET Core 3.1
Issues.Body:
We weren't able to migrate our WPF app to .NET Core 3.1 because MutexRights wasn't available. Hope it gets implemented soon.

Unsupported (per Portability Analyzer): 
M:System.Threading.Mutex.TryOpenExisting(System.String,System.Security.AccessControl.MutexRights,System.Threading.Mutex@)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "MutexRights is not available in .NET Core 3.1" (#2473)

Issues.Title: Using UIAutomation to find an ItemsControl's selected item
Issues.Body:
Hi,
I am trying to use UIAutomation to find the selected item from an ItemsControl, is this possible? I have looked at the ItemsControlAutomationPeer and it seems that FindItemByProperty can only have the propertyId for Name, AutomationId and ControlType passed into it, is that correct?

Thanks
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Using UIAutomation to find an ItemsControl's selected item" (#2474)
